titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, Developing Countries Program, Office Files of Mary Elen (Michele) Heisler
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, Developing Countries Program, Office Files of Mary Elen (Michele) Heisler FA526

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-07-01 01:36:12 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, Developing Countries Program, Office Files of Mary Elen (Michele) Heisler

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimal Processing has been conducted to establish basic intellectual and physical control of the material and assess immediate preservation and conservation needs. Material remains as received, in original folders and storage boxes.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Michele Heisler is a doctor, human rights advocate, and former program officer at the Ford Foundation. Heisler initially worked as an Assistant Program Officer in the Ford Foundation's Developing Country Programs. Following a change in the Foundation's programming structure, Heisler became an Assistant Program Officer in the Latin America and Caribbean Programs.

After leaving the Ford Foundation, Heisler worked as a consultant to the United Nations Truth Commission in El Salvador. Some of Heisler's early work with Physicians for Human Rights (PHR) consisted of consulting with a focus on research and writing studies when she was a medical student. From between 2010 and 2019, she served on the PHR Board of Directors and then became the organization's Medical Director. She has also worked as a professor of internal medicine and public health at the University of Michigan.

Heisler earned her M.D. from Harvard University, her M.P.A. from Princeton University, and completed a residency in internal medicine and health services research training at the University of Michigan as a Robert Wood Johnson Clinical Scholar.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Ford Foundation has title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.

The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Ford Foundation.
